definition: to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
Kingdom Hall (place of worship used by Jehovah's Witnesses)

sentences.english: This Saturday is my birthday and I'm goingto hold a party in my house.
sentences.chinese: 這個星期六是我的生日，我要在我家舉辦一個聚會。

sentences.english: She felt especially insecure in small gatherings.
sentences.chinese: 在小聚會上，她覺得特別沒有安全感。

sentences.english: Don't be such a party pooper , the party has just started.
sentences.chinese: 不要那麼掃興，聚會纔剛剛開始。

sentences.english: At the Vanity Fair party, they were let in the back door.
sentences.chinese: 在《名利場》雜誌的聚會上，他們從後門進來。

sentences.english: Won't you join the party dressed to kill?
sentences.chinese: 你非得穿得這麼妖豔去參加那個聚會嗎？

sentences.english: Today, I went to my long-distance boyfriend's party.
sentences.chinese: 今天我去參加異地戀男友的聚會。

sentences.english: Are you going to the tailgate party this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 你今天下午要去足球賽前的聚會嗎？

sentences.english: A: They love to have fun. They love to have parties and spend time with their friends.
sentences.chinese: 他們愛玩，喜歡各種聚會，跟朋友們在一起。

sentences.english: He alterd into his new dress or go to the party.
sentences.chinese: 他換上新衣服去參加聚會。

sentences.english: The party fizzled out before midnight.
sentences.chinese: 參加聚會的人在午夜前作鳥獸散。

sentences.english: None of us was going to the party.
sentences.chinese: 我們之中沒人想去參加那個聚會。

sentences.english: It's the same feeling that compels people to attend high school reunions.
sentences.chinese: 這和人們不願意參加高中同學聚會的原因是一樣的。

sentences.english: It was the first time for Sally to meet her boyfriend at a party.
sentences.chinese: 莎莉第一次遇見她的男朋友是在一個聚會上。

sentences.english: An administration official said the Obamas would foot the bill for the celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 一個政府官員說，奧巴馬要爲聚會活動自掏腰包。

sentences.english: It's bridge club day. Every fourth Wednesday a the month.
sentences.chinese: 每個月的第四個禮拜三是她們的橋牌聚會日。

sentences.english: “If you go to a pumping party, you can have it tonight, ” Dr. Gorton said.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想去幫聚會，你今天晚上就可以做到。

definition: to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
to pay a visit/to call on
